_WHAT_IS_PORACLE: Poracle is an alert bot that sends notifications to Discord or Telegram.
When a Pokemon spawns, a raid starts, or a quest appears, Poracle can
send you a message with details like location, IVs, and time remaining.
Users can set up custom alerts (e.g., 'notify me when 100% IV Gible spawns')
This is an OPTIONAL feature - run poracle.sh to enable it.

database._client_explanation: Database type. 'mysql' works for both MySQL and MariaDB (which this setup uses).

conn._host_explanation: Database server address. 'database' is the MariaDB container name in Docker.
conn._port_explanation: Database port. 3306 is the standard MySQL/MariaDB port.
conn._user_explanation: Database username. Must match MYSQL_USER in your .env file.
conn._password_explanation: Database password. The setup script replaces 'CHANGE_ME' with your actual password. Must match MYSQL_PASSWORD in .env.
conn._database_explanation: The specific database Poracle uses to store user preferences and alert settings.

server._description: Webhook server settings - receives data from Golbat
server._host_explanation: Network interface to listen on. '0.0.0.0' = accept connections from any source (needed for Docker).
server._port_explanation: Port for incoming webhooks from Golbat. When Golbat sends Pokemon/raid data, it goes to this port.

general._description: What types of alerts Poracle can send
general._locale_explanation: Language for alert messages. 'en' = English. Options: en, de, fr, es, etc.
general._pokemon_explanation: Enable Pokemon spawn alerts. true = users can get notified when Pokemon appear.
general._pokestops_explanation: Enable Pokestop alerts (for new stops, etc.).
general._lures_explanation: Enable Lure alerts. Notify when someone places a lure module.
general._pokestopLures_explanation: Same as lures - enables lure notifications.
general._pokestopInvasions_explanation: Same as invasions - Team Rocket notification toggle.
general._gyms_explanation: Enable gym-related alerts (gym changes, new gyms).
general._raids_explanation: Enable raid alerts. Notify when raid eggs appear or bosses hatch.
general._nests_explanation: Enable nest change alerts (requires Fletchling integration).
general._quests_explanation: Enable Pokestop quest alerts (field research tasks).
general._weather_explanation: Enable weather change alerts. false = off (usually too spammy).
general._greeting_explanation: Send a welcome message when users first interact with the bot.
general._alterPokemon_explanation: Allow users to modify their Pokemon alert settings via commands.
general._roleCheckDPokemon_explanation: Check Discord roles before allowing Pokemon alerts. false = everyone can set alerts.
general._defaults_explanation: Default filter settings for each alert type. Empty {} means no defaults - users set their own. Advanced: set default IV filters, distances, etc.

discord._description: Discord bot settings - configure if using Discord for alerts
discord._enabled_explanation: Turn Discord bot on/off. Set to true and configure below to use Discord alerts.
discord._prefix_explanation: Command prefix for bot commands. '!' means users type !help, !track, etc.
discord._token_explanation: Your Discord bot's secret token. Get this from Discord Developer Portal when you create a bot. KEEP THIS SECRET!
discord._channels_explanation: Discord channel IDs where bot commands are allowed. Empty = all channels. Add channel IDs to restrict.
discord._admins_explanation: Discord user IDs who can use admin commands. Get your ID by enabling Developer Mode in Discord settings, then right-click your name.
discord._limitSec_explanation: Rate limit window in seconds. 0 = no rate limiting.
discord._limitAmount_explanation: Max commands per rate limit window. 0 = unlimited.
discord._roles_explanation: Discord role IDs required to use each alert type. Empty [] = no role required (everyone can use). Add role IDs to restrict access.

telegram._description: Telegram bot settings - configure if using Telegram for alerts
telegram._enabled_explanation: Turn Telegram bot on/off. Set to true to use Telegram alerts.
telegram._token_explanation: Your Telegram bot token. Get this from @BotFather on Telegram when you create a bot.
telegram._channels_explanation: Telegram chat/channel IDs where bot is allowed. Empty = allow everywhere.
telegram._admins_explanation: Telegram user IDs who can use admin commands. Get your ID from @userinfobot.
telegram._roles_explanation: Same as Discord roles but for Telegram groups.

geocoding._description: Settings for converting coordinates to addresses in alert messages
geocoding._provider_explanation: Service used to get addresses from coordinates. 'nominatim' = free OpenStreetMap service.
geocoding._providerURL_explanation: URL of the geocoding service. Default is the public free Nominatim server.
geocoding._cacheDetail_explanation: How much location detail to cache. 'city' = cache at city level (reduces API calls).

logging._logLevel_explanation: How much detail to log. Options: error (least), warn, info (normal), verbose, debug (most). 'info' is good for normal use.

pvp._pokemon_explanation: Include PVP rank info in Pokemon alerts.
pvp._pokemon_best_explanation: Show the Pokemon's best PVP league ranking.
pvp._pokemon_worst_explanation: Show the Pokemon's worst PVP league ranking.
pvp._pokemon_value_explanation: Show the stat product value for PVP.
